TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SendPacketsElement extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents an element in a array.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement> class is used to enhance the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket> class for use by server applications that use asynchronous network I/O to achieve the highest performance. The <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement> class is used with the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SocketAsyncEventArgs.SendPacketsElements%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to get or set a data buffer or file to be sent using the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.SendPacketsAsync%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.

Docs.threadsafe: Instances of this class are thread safe.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

The <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement> class is used with the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SocketAsyncEventArgs.SendPacketsElements%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to get or set a data buffer or file to be sent using the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.SendPacketsAsync%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.

Docs.param: The filename of the file to be transmitted using the method.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement.%23ctor%28System.String%29> constructor initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement> class with a filename of a file. The <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement> class is used with the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SocketAsyncEventArgs.SendPacketsElements%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to get or set a data buffer or file to be sent using the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.SendPacketsAsync%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.
Universal Naming Convention (UNC) paths are supported by the `filepath` parameter. If the file is in the current working directory, no path information needs to be specified.

Docs.param: The filename of the file to be transmitted using the method.
The offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the file to the location in the file to start sending the file specified in the parameter.
The number of bytes to send starting from the parameter. If is zero, the entire file is sent.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified filename path, offset, and count.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Int32%29> constructor initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement> class with a filename of a file. The <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement> class is used with the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SocketAsyncEventArgs.SendPacketsElements%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to get or set a data buffer or file to be sent using the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.SendPacketsAsync%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.
Universal Naming Convention (UNC) paths are supported by the `filepath` parameter. If the file is in the current working directory, no path information needs to be specified.

Docs.exception:
The and parameters must be greater than or equal to zero.
The and must be less than the size of the file indicated by the parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: public SendPacketsElement (byte[] buffer, int offset, int count, bool endOfPacket);

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: A byte array of data to send using the method.
The offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the to the location in the to start sending the data specified in the parameter.
The number bytes to send starting from the parameter. If is zero, no bytes are sent.

A Boolean value that specifies that this element should not be combined with the next element in a single send request from the sockets layer to the transport. This flag is used for granular control of the content of each message on a datagram or message-oriented socket.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified buffer, buffer offset, and count with an option to combine this element with the next element in a single send request from the sockets layer to the transport.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement.%23ctor%28System.Byte%5B%5D%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Boolean%29> constructor initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement> class with a byte array of data. The <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement> class is used with the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SocketAsyncEventArgs.SendPacketsElements%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to get or set a data buffer or file to be sent using the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.SendPacketsAsync%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.

Docs.exception:
The and parameters must be greater than or equal to zero.
The and must be less than the size of the buffer

A Boolean value that specifies that this element should not be combined with the next element in a single send request from the sockets layer to the transport. This flag is used for granular control of the content of each message on a datagram or message-oriented socket.

## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Int32%2CSystem.Boolean%29> constructor initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement> class with a filename of a file. The <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement> class is used with the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SocketAsyncEventArgs.SendPacketsElements%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to get or set a data buffer or file to be sent using the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.SendPacketsAsync%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.
Universal Naming Convention (UNC) paths are supported by the `filepath` parameter. If the file is in the current working directory, no path information needs to be specified.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the count of bytes to be sent.
Docs.value: The count of bytes to send if the class was initialized with a parameter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default value for the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement.Count%2A> property is zero if the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement> class was not initialized with a `count` parameter.
If <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement.Count%2A> is zero for a file, the entire file is sent. If <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement.Count%2A> is zero for a buffer, no bytes are sent.

Docs.summary: Gets a Boolean value that indicates if this element should not be combined with the next element in a single send request from the sockets layer to the transport.
Docs.value: A Boolean value that indicates if this element should not be combined with the next element in a single send request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default value for the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement.EndOfPacket%2A> property is false if the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement> class was not initialized with an `endOfPacket` parameter set to true.

Docs.summary: Gets the filename of the file to send if the class was initialized with a parameter.
Docs.value: The filename of the file to send if the class was initialized with a parameter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Universal Naming Convention (UNC) paths are supported by the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement.FilePath%2A> property. If the file is in the current working directory, no path information needs to be specified.
The default value for the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement.FilePath%2A> property is an empty string if the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement> class was not initialized with a `filepath` parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default value for the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement.Offset%2A> property is zero if the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SendPacketsElement> class was not initialized with an `offset` parameter.
